advanced.touchTail

Class TouchTailComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.mt4j.components.MTComponent
      • org.mt4j.components.visibleComponents.AbstractVisibleComponent
        • advanced.touchTail.TouchTailComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IMTComponent, IMTComponent3D, IMTInputEventListener, IGestureEventListener

    public class TouchTailComponent
extends AbstractVisibleComponent
    The Class TouchTailComponent. Yellowtail by Golan Levin (www.flong.com) Yellowtail (1998-2000) is an interactive software system for the gestural creation and performance of real-time abstract animation. Yellowtail repeats a user's strokes end-over-end, enabling simultaneous specification of a line's shape and quality of movement. Each line repeats according to its own period, producing an ever-changing and responsive display of lively, worm-like textures.

    • Method Detail

      • drawComponent

        public void drawComponent(processing.core.PGraphics g)
        Description copied from class: MTComponent
        Executes this component's drawing commands (Not its children!). The component's matrix has to be made current before drawing.
        This method can be overridden in subclasses and filled with drawing commands.
        NOTE: This method is called by the application. Usually you should not invoke this method directly!
        Specified by:
        drawComponent in interface IMTComponent
        Specified by:
        drawComponent in class AbstractVisibleComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics context

      • clearTails

        public void clearTails()

      • getIntersectionLocal

        public Vector3D getIntersectionLocal(Ray ray)
        Description copied from class: MTComponent
        Returns the intersection point of the ray and this component (children are not checked for intersections). Usually, if the component has a bounding shape assigned, the bounds are checked for an intersection. Shapes may also check the shape itself for intersection.
        The ray is assumed to already be in local component space (not in global space).
        If the component is not intersected, null is returned.
        Overrides:
        getIntersectionLocal in class MTComponent
        Parameters:
        ray - the rays, in local space
        Returns:
        the component local intersection point
        See Also:
        MTComponent.globalToLocal(org.mt4j.util.math.Vector3D)
